            temp.push_back(s[i]);
        }
    }
    for(int i=0;i<temp.size();i++){
        result.push_back(temp[i]);
    }
    return result;
}

        if(temp[i]!=temp[temp.size()-i-1]){

        }

}

The Brazilian factorial is defined as:
brazilian_factorial(n) = n! * (n-1)! * (n-2)! *... * 1!
where n > 0

For example:
>>> special_factorila(4)
288

The function will receive an integer as input and should return the special
factorial of this integer.
*/
#include<stdio.h>
using namespace std;
long long special_factorila(int n){
    long long ans=1;
    for(int i=2;i<=n;i++){
        ans*=i;
    }
    return ans;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Filter given vector of any python values only for integers
>>> filetr_integers({"a", 3.14, 5})
{5}
>>> filetr_integers({1, 2, 3, "abc", {}, {}})
{1, 2, 3}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
#include<boost/any.hpp>
#include<list>
typedef std::list<boost::any> list_any;
using namespace std;
vector<int> filetr_integers(list_any values){
    vector<int> result;
    for(list_any v: values){
        for(auto i: v){
            if(i.is_integer()){
                result.push_back(i);
            }
        }
    }
    return result;
}

double poly(vector<double> xs, double x){
    /* 
    Evaluates polynomial with coefficients xs at point x. return xs[0] + xs[1] * x + xs[1] * x^2 +.... xs[n] * x^n 
    */
    double sum=0;
    int i;
    for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
    {
        sum+=xs[i]*pow(x,i);
    }
    return sum;
}

double find_zero(vector<double> xs){
    /*
    xs are coefficients of a polynomial. find_zero find x such that poly(x) = 0. find_zero returns only only zero point, even if there are many. 
    Moreover, find_zero only takes list xs having even number of coefficients and largest non zero coefficient as it guarantees a solution.
    >>> round(find_zero([1, 2]), 2) #f(x) = 1 + 2x 
    -0.5 
    >>> round(find_zero([-6, 11, -6, 1]), 2) # (x - 1) * (x - 2) * (x - 3) = -6 + 11x - 6x^2 + x^3 
    1.0
    */
    double zero=0;
    double sum=0;
    double sum2=0;
    int i;
    for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
    {
        sum+=xs[i]*xs[i];
        sum2+=xs[i]*xs[i];
    }
    if (sum2==0)
    {
        zero=sum/2;
    }
    else
    {
        zero=sum2/(sum*sum);
    }
    return zero;
}

}

<|endoftext|>/*
Circular shift the digits of the integer x, shift the digits right by shift
and return the result as a string.
If shift > number of digits, return digits reversed.
>>> circular_shift(12, 1)
"21"
>>> circular_shift(12, 2)
"12"
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
string circular_shift(int x,int shift){
    string s;
    for(int i=0;i<shift;i++){
        cout<<x%10<<" ";
        x/=10;
    }
    for(int i=0;i<x;i++){
        cout<<x%10<<" ";
        x/=10;
    }
    for(int i=0;i<shift;i++){
        cout<<x%10<<" ";
        x/=10;
    }
    for(int i=0;i<x;i++){
        cout<<x%10<<" ";
        x/=10;
    }
    return s;
}

check_map_case({{"a","apple"}, {"A","banana"}, {"B","banana"}}) should return false.

check_map_case({{"Name","John"}, {"Age","36"}, {"City","Houston"}}) should return false.

*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
#include<map>

bool check_dcit_case(map<string,string> dict){
    map<string,string>::iterator it;

        if(it->first[0]==it->second[0]&&it->first[1]==it->second[1]){
            return true;
        }
    }
    return false;
}

}
